p: To analyze synchrony in epidemic timing, wavelet phase-angles were also reconstructed from the 136 ILI time-series. Following standard procedures, each series was first padded with zeros to the nearest power of two, then log-transformed and standardized to reduce variability and noise obscuring the underlying periodic features [ 5, 23]. The standardized series were then decomposed into periodic signals using a Morlet wavelet function within the ‘WaveletComp’ library in R [ 24]. Finally, phase-angle trajectories were reconstructed from the dominant annual period of each decomposed series and used for the synchrony analysis [ 5, 23, 25]. Note that analysis performed on phase trajectories without prior transformations, or with square root transformations, gave qualitatively similar results.
